Author: Gidget#2374
Content:
Just to highlight here:

Tap additional user base from BNB Chain and L2 chains


No need for deployment on the BNB chain, the dappOS version of Curve will support seamless access from BSC/ ETH wallet to all Curve pools across Arbitrum, Optimism and more trending Layer2 chains and BNB chain with significantly simplified UX. This function will also scale Curve user base additionally on chains Curve has already deployed on, such as KAVA. This efficient multi-chain operation strategy also saves much cost and time for the Curve developers.

Author: Gidget#2374
Content: We already have supported GMX, Perpetual, and more leading projects.

Author: raal#1396
Content:
Hi, I'm a newbe, and I would like to understand much more how the voting system works.
I understand these things:
1- I need any LP token in staking
2- lock CRV to get veCRV and be able to vote any LP using my veCRV.
3- deposit other CRV tokens of my wallet to boost the miner power, right?

if this is right, I have this question: My LP will get lost over time and generate CRV rewards?

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: 1. Its not a requirement to vote

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: 2. Yep in order to vote for a pool to get more CRV share for it you need to have veCRV

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: 3. Not sure what do you mean by that

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: In order to boost your LP position you need to have veCRV

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: once you have your veCRV, just claim rewards on any pool(if there is CRV rewards for that pool and your LP tokens are staked of course)  and boost will apply

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: your LP tokens won't get lost over time. The number of LP tokens stays the same and price of each token growth

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: But you'll earn CRV rewards yes.(in case if pool have any and your LP tokens are staked in the gauge)

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: or you can use platforms like stakedao, convex

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: stake LP tokens there and get a boost too

Author: raal#1396
Content:
Thanks for answering me all questions above. 
Regarding the 3d questions, I wanted to understand how the calculation page works.
Because you need to use deposited tokens to improve the profit of any LP, ( I guessed you needed to use tokens which were locked for a period of time from the Minter page, similar to the Locked page. The difference is that these deposited tokens are only using to boost some LP token... because the CRV tokens which were locked by the Locked page will be used for pool voting).

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: you dont "spend" your veCRV by voting. The amount stays the same

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: you obviously cant vote for many pools with maximum(e.g vote for 10 pools with 1000 veCRV if you have only 1000 veCRV)

Author: dookeygrinder#1820
Content: so you can vote and boost your positions. Also your veCRV will apply to all pools you are in

Content:
was reading through some of the gauge proposals and was struck by the amount of risk analysis some of them go through, i.e., https://cryptorisks.substack.com/p/asset-risk-assessment-liquid-lockers
is the main reason the gauge proposals are vetted to this degree to protect other participants in the curve ecosystem from voting on, and supplying liquidity to, token pairs that may fall victim to exploits, hacks, or rugs? because in that scenario mainly the lp'ers get rekt, curve the protocol should be fine, and the voters maybe feel bad for a week. is that the extent or what am i missing?

Author: __fiddy__
Content:
the risk stuff is a dao-funded endeavor. its a due-diligence team that checks for obvious rugs or unsound protocol design.

they only provide guidance, and will occasionally submit proposals for the dao to execute. but the dao or anyone is not obliged to follow their guidance to the teeth. that's always up to individual voter's discretion.

Author: __fiddy__
Content: source: i used to work at llamarisk.

Author: __fiddy__
Content: tagging @WormholeOracle to add more color. he's the lead of that project (it's his baby) and has the most amount of info on that.

Author: wormholeoracle
Content: risk team began after an incident when Mochi essentially stole from LPs by minting a large amount of USDM, swapping in the pool to accumulate a large CVX stake. What they did was widely considered malicious and a possible governance attack on Curve if action wasnt taken against it. The result was Curve emergency killed the USDM gauge and Convex blacklisted the Mochi controlled CVX. Llama Risk's goal is to help the DAO be proactive so something like this doesnt happen again

Author: wormholeoracle
Content: I also personally feel that by taking an active interest in the safety of its users, Curve holds itself to a higher standard than our competitors and I hope that long term that diligence translates into a more trusted reputation and favorable position with regulators

Author: br0k3
Content: that's helpful context, thank you. i remember the Mochi attack and emergency action. definitely wasn't knocking it, just wanted to better understand its purpose. i agree that it's good for reputation protection and protection against governance exploits

Author: Jimmy#1712
Content:
Hello everyone! I wanted to provide an update on the proposal I posted on the governance forum four days ago. Currently, it is still pending for review and approval. It's my first proposal to the curve community, so I'm not sure about the exact timeline for when the proposal will become publicly available for discussion among all CRV holders.

I would appreciate any information or guidance regarding the process and when we can expect the proposal to be accessible to the wider community. I'm excited to engage in meaningful discussions and gather valuable feedback from fellow CRV holders. Thank you for your understanding, and I look forward to participating in the community's decision-making process soon.

Author: kendrickllama
Content: approved

Author: Jimmy#1712
Content: Thank you @Kendrick Llama ğŸ¦™  for your approval!

Author: kendrickllama
Content: you are welcome ser

Author: Jimmy#1712
Content:
I'm pleased to share that I recently posted a proposal titled "Proposal to Extend Core Team Vesting Time" on the Curve governance forum. You can find the proposal at this link: https://gov.curve.fi/t/proposal-to-extend-core-team-vesting-time/9307

I would like to extend a warm welcome to everyone in the community to provide their valuable input and insights on this proposal. Your feedback and thoughts are crucial in shaping the future direction of Curve's core team vesting policy.

I encourage you all to review the proposal and share your opinions, concerns, or suggestions. Together, we can engage in constructive discussions to ensure the best possible outcome for the Curve ecosystem. Thank you in advance for your participation, and I'm eager to hear your perspectives on this important matter.

Author: blockenthusiast
Content: Random but is there an easy way to map which gauge on mainnet reflects which gauge in L2s

Author: mimaklas
Content: the child gauge address on sidechain/l2s is the root gauge implementation on mainnet

Author: mimaklas
Content: same address

Author: mimaklas
Content: for example, the crvUSD/CRV gauge (Base) https://basescan.org/address/0x89289dc2192914a9f0674f1e9a17c56456549b8a#code

Author: mimaklas
Content: and its root implementation on eth mainnet https://etherscan.io/address/0x89289DC2192914a9F0674f1E9A17C56456549b8A#code

Author: blockenthusiast
Content: Oh dope. For some reason didn't expect the contract addresses to match since seem to have different functions available.. Have chain ID but not other info on L1.  Nice will run queries against the chain ID to snag the gauge name etc that's on L2. Perfect. Thank you!

Author: blockenthusiast
Content:
Why might a pool 9.6m liquidity on L1 display a yield of 3.9->9.6% with ~5M votes
while a pool with 9.8m liquidity on Base display a yield of 8.9->22.2 with ~0.5M votes? Is each layer given a fixed issuance and that's divided by votes? I though issuance per layer had an upper limit but not a fixed flow.  Curious if UI issue or I've been mistaken

Author: mimaklas
Content: well

Author: mimaklas
Content: CRV rewards on Base, is not from CRV inflation

Author: mimaklas
Content: is from Michael

Author: mimaklas
Content: 3 base gauges will start having CRV from inflation after Thrusday 00:00 UTC

Author: mimaklas
Content: also

Author: mimaklas
Content: sidechain/l2s gauges is 1 week behind

Author: mimaklas
Content: 1 week gauge receive votes > next week accumulate CRV on eth mainnet (based on previous week weight) > one week later accumulated CRV from previous week bridged from ETH mainnet e.g. to Base

Author: blockenthusiast
Content: Lolz oh well that makes perfect sense then. Much appreciate the clarity

Author: mimaklas
Content: no worries ser

I am Alex from BaseDAO, representing our community, and we are keenly interested in exploring a partnership with your protocol. BaseDAO is the first decentralized investment DAO on the Base chain, dedicated to fostering the development and innovation within the Base chain ecosystem.

We firmly believe that collaborating with your protocol can offer both parties tremendous opportunities and mutually beneficial prospects. We propose several collaboration methods to facilitate deeper engagement and shared growth:

1. **AMA Sessions**: We can organize online AMA sessions, inviting experts from your team to share insights about your project and industry perspectives with our community members. We look forward to discussing these collaboration methods in more detail, as well as how we can collectively achieve our shared goals.
